Literature Review: Selective attention inside working memory plays a crucial role in guiding behavior, and its functions are multifaceted and context-dependent. This literature review aims to provide an overview of the current understanding of selective attention inside working memory, its purpose, targets, sources, and mechanisms, using visual working memory as a model. We will discuss the relationship between selective attention and working memory, and how considering both together can lead to a more comprehensive understanding of how the mind serves behavior.
